info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 03 at 1:42PM EDT until June 03 at 2:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Greenville County in Upstate South Carolina... West central Spartanburg County in Upstate South Carolina... * Until 230 PM EDT. * At 141 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Greenville Downtown, or over Cherrydale Point, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Berea, Five Forks, Welcome and Travelers Rest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
